# Design Doc Template

> Repeatable file template — copy into `docs/design/` when exploring a new feature or capability. Keep the focus on user experience, pacing, and high-level constraints—leave implementation details to the spec.

- **Feature / System Name:**
- **Author / Date:**
- **Status:** Draft / In Review / Approved

## Summary

- High-level pitch (two or three sentences) describing what this design adds and why it matters.

## Goals

- Player-facing outcomes or experiential pillars this design must achieve.
- Success criteria that can be observed in playtests.

## Non-Goals / Guardrails

- Explicitly state what this design will not attempt so scope stays focused.

## Core Loop / Flow

- Step-by-step description of how the player engages with the feature.
- Include timing expectations, feedback moments, fail states, and recovery paths.

## Systems Interactions

- Existing mechanics this touches (link to other design docs or feature cards).
- Dependencies or knock-on effects (e.g., economy, combat, progression).

## Content & Narrative Hooks

- Tone, lore, or thematic beats that must be present.
- Asset or audio requirements (placeholder vs final).

## Telemetry & Balancing Notes

- Metrics to capture during tests.
- Tunable parameters the spec should expose.

## Accessibility & UX Considerations

- Control schemes, readability needs, or alternate flows to support.

## Open Questions

- Bulleted list of items to resolve before promotion to a spec.
- Link to TBD tracker entries once created.

## Approval Checklist

- [ ] Goals reviewed with design lead.
- [ ] Dependencies acknowledged by impacted disciplines.
- [ ] Open questions assigned owners and target dates.
